question:
World Health Organization (WHO) has declared India free from which of the following diseases?
  1. Maternal and neonatal tetanus
  2. YAWS
  3. Polio
  4. Small Pox
Select the correct option from codes given below:
explanation: India was declared free of maternal and neonatal tetanus on May 15, 2015. World Health Organization (WHO) on March 27, 2014 officially declared India as “Polio Free”. Recently, India became the first country in the world to be officially declared YAWS-Free. World Health Organization (WHO) declared India free from Small Pox on April 23, 2014.
